titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 2
CWG14260

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.idno: Flat Storage Box: 11th Ky Cav (US) Muster Rolls, Bundle 6

body.p:
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 2 } WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, January 3d, 1865.

8. The following officers of the 11th Kentucky Cavalry are hereby discharged the service of the United States, as of the dates set opposite their respective names, on account of unfitness for military duty, with condition that they shall receive no final payments, until they have satsified the Pay Department that they are not indebted to the Government: --
Captain Jacob Cozatt, to date February 28th, 1864, his name having been dropped from the rolls since that time.
Captain Presley F. Hunsbrough, to date August 31st, 1864, there being no rolls filed in this Office bearing his name since that date.
Lieutenant and Adjutant W. P. Pierce, to date February 28th, 1864, there being no rolls filed in this Office bearing his name since that date.

By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
E D Townsend
Assistant Adjutant General.
Lt W. P. Pirerce has been promoted to a captancy in the Regt & the Dept should be notified of the fact.
